results.title: Zoo animals in the wild: bears
results.creator_credit: Mel Waskin, Bill Walker and Coronet Films
results.brief_description: Points out some of the characteristics of bears such as their strength, their playfulness, and their curiosity as well as their inclination to be solitary animals. Suitable for middle and upper primary levels.

results.title: Baboons
results.brief_description: Part of a series called “Zoo animals in the wild”, this film shows the baboon travelling in troops, looking for food and caring for its young. Suitable for mid-upper Primary school. No other credits available.

results.brief_description: Provides a brief look at the life style and habits of the ape in its natural environments, focusing on the orangutan.

results.title: What's in a spider web (observing animals)
results.creator_credit: Reinald Werrenrath Jr and Goldberg-Werrenrath Productions
results.brief_description: Notes the difference between spiders and insects, the various methods spiders have of weaving webs, their methods of trapping prey, and the laying of eggs. From the series “Science fact and fun series”.

results.title: Making sense of it: using your senses
results.brief_description: Two children learn about the ecology of a forest using their senses to identify their environment. Also presents basic information about classification and identification in terms of scientific methods. Suitable for upper primary level.

results.title: Looking into things using scientific instruments
results.creator_credit: Reinald Werrenrath Jr and Journal Films
results.brief_description: Shows how to conduct scientific observations, using a fly as a case study. demonstrates how to measure and weigh using small units and how to make a balance for measuring. Also illustrates the use of the microscope, introducing the idea of magnification. Part of the Science fact and fun series. Suitable for upper primary level.

results.title: How much does the earth weigh?: measurement and mass
results.creator_credit: Reinald Werrenrath Jr and Goldberg-Werrenrath Productions
results.brief_description: Shows how to calculate the size and composition of the earth, explaining the difference between weight and mass using a spring scale and a balance scale. Also covers the scientific ideas of displacement, volume and density.

results.title: Arcs and sparks (Testing)
results.creator_credit: Reinald Werrenrath Jr and Goldberg-Werrenrath Productions
results.brief_description: Introduces the scientific idea that magnetism and electricity are related. Shows some safe ways to investigate that relationship. Suitable for Upper-Primary students.

results.title: Hospitals and everything like that
results.brief_description: Designed to allay children’s fears of the hospitalisation process. Follows a young girl suffering from an asthmatic complaint as she checks into the hospital and is given routine check-ups and special tests. Shows the sympathetic and supportive nature of the hospital staff. Suitable for upper primary level.

results.title: A Life worth living
results.creator_credit: Michael Latham, Antony Jay, Peter Robinson and Video Arts
results.brief_description: Recapitulates points made in the first four parts of the series to show how a community progresses from a state of subsistence to surplus: then, using animation and documentary footage, shows how the surplus produced by a worker is in effect swapped by him for all the other things he needs but does not produce himself. Narrated by Judy Cornwell, Desmond Carrington.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Michael Latham, Antony Jay, Peter Robinson and Video Arts
